name: Qobuz
tag_list: internet-music, streaming-music, hd-music, editorial, playlists, cloud
overview:
Qobuz is a high quality music service (based in Paris - France) providing :

  • a music store (per track/album download).
  • an on-demand streaming service (on a subscription basis).

Qobuz offers a growing online catalogue featuring more than 10 million tracks (by 2012), including all the majors and leading independent record labels. Users can choose the quality (and even the download format) between:

  • Standard (lossy 320 kbps) - available for downloading and streaming
  • True CD Quality (lossless 16-bit / 44.1 kHz) - available for downloading and streaming
  • StudioMasters (lossless HD 24-bit / up to 192 kHz) - only available for downloading (more than 2 000 albums by 2012)

This makes Qobuz the only music provider in the world to offer its entire catalogue (including EMI, Sony, Universal and Warner Music Group) in lossless formats on both downloading and streaming.

Qobuz has developped a complete app ecosystem providing access to its catalogue everywhere - at home, on a connected Hi-Fi device, on the web and even offline :

  • Qobuz Desktop (OS X and Windows)
  • Qobuz on Sonos
  • Qobuz Player, web based
  • Qobuz Mobile for smartphones and tablets (iOS, android…)
  • Qobuz for Windows 8 and Windows RT

Qobuz has also a public API which can be used by third parties to develop an app (there is already an XBMC add-on and a squeezebox plugin).

The whole catalogue is currently available in France, Belgium, Switzerland and Luxembourg. There are plans for other European countries and overseas.

Qobuz also includes a musical information feed, a daily magazine with artists interviews and podcasts, concert agenda, Hi-Fi bench test, etc..
